article.title: Robust Frequent Directions with Application in Online Learning

multiple_choice_question.text: Which sketching method consistently achieves the lowest relative spectral norm error across all six datasets ("a9a," "gisette," "sido0," "farm-ads," "rcv1," and "real-sim") when approximating the covariance matrix?

When comparing Parameterized Frequent Directions (PFD) with different hyperparameter (β) values and Robust Frequent Directions (RFD), which statement is generally true about their performance in approximating the covariance matrix?
choices: PFD always achieves lower relative spectral norm error than RFD regardless of the β value.
RFD consistently outperforms PFD across all datasets and β values.
PFD can sometimes achieve lower errors than RFD with a well-tuned β, but RFD generally performs better without needing hyperparameter tuning.
PFD and RFD exhibit identical performance regardless of β value or dataset.

multiple_choice_question.text: Observing the test error at the end of one pass for different α0 values on datasets "a9a," "gisette," and "sido0," which sketched online Newton method demonstrates the least sensitivity to the choice of α0?
Similar to Figure 3, but focusing on "farm-ads," "rcv1," and "real-sim" datasets, which sketched online Newton method consistently exhibits robustness to changes in the regularization parameter α0?
This figure compares the online error rate between the full online Newton step (FULL-ON) and RFD-SON with α0=0 (RFD0-SON). What does the figure suggest about the performance of RFD0-SON?
choices: RFD0-SON consistently has lower online error rate than FULL-ON across all three datasets.
The online error rate of RFD0-SON is comparable to FULL-ON, demonstrating its effectiveness despite using sketching.
RFD0-SON performs significantly worse than FULL-ON in terms of online error rate.
The figure does not provide sufficient information to compare the performance of RFD0-SON and FULL-ON.

multiple_choice_question.text: Examining the online error rates of different sketched online Newton methods on the "a9a" dataset, which method demonstrates a clear advantage in terms of robustness to variations in α0?
